title: Wayne Rooney dotes on son Kit before enjoying a day of water sports with his sons and father-in-law
text:
He's celebrating his 34th birthday in Barbados with his in-laws and his sons.

And Wayne Rooney doted on his second youngest boy Kit, three, before they joined other sons Klay, six and Kai, nine and their grandfather Tony McLoughlin for a spot of watersports as they continued the birthday celebration in Barbados on Thursday.

The family outing comes as Wayne's wife Coleen, 33, remained at home in England after being being struck down with an infection in the wake of the ongoing drama with fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy.

That's my boy: Wayne Rooney dotes on son Kit before enjoying a day of watersports with his boys and father-in-law as they continued the birthday celebration in Barbados on Thursday

Footballer Wayne was snapped strapping his adorable son into his life jacket, while other son Klay tended was seen adjusting his own jacket.

Embracing the Caribbean sun, Wayne sported a black T-shirt and blue patterned shorts, which he wore with his own life jacket.

The group then waded into the water as they made their way onto a large inflatable ahead of their fun ride.

The thrill-seekers were seen squealing in delight as they were hurled across the water on the back of a speed boat.

Boys and their toys: The family outing comes as Wayne's wife Coleen, 33, remained at home in England after being being struck down with an infection

Helping hand: Footballer Wayne was snapped strapping his adorable son into his life jacket, while other son Klay tended was seen adjusting his own jacket

As little Kit appeared quite afraid of the experience, his older brother Klay appeared to be loving life as he sat up on the edge of the inflatable.

Meanwhile, Wayne appeared to be thoroughly enjoying himself as he laughed away following the water ride.

Back on dry land, the sports star was surrounded by adoring fans as they couldn't wait to get a snap of their idol.

Fun in the sun: Embracing the Caribbean sun, Wayne sported a black T-shirt and blue patterned shorts, which he wore with his own life jacket

My boys: Wayne was enjoying a break at the beach with two of his boys

Buckle up: The footballer ensured his sons were carefully strapped into their life jackets ahead of the ride

Delightful: The Rooney boys couldn't hide the joys from their faces as they enjoyed the ride

While Wayne and the boys were soaking up the Bajan sun, Coleen was at home recovering from an infection.

Earlier on Thursday, she took to Instagram where she wished her husband a happy 34th birthday.

The WAG posted a sweet snap of the footballer taken at Universal Studios in Orlando with their four sons Kit, three, Klay, six, Kai, nine, and Cass, 20 months.

Alongside a snap of Wayne and his boys, Coleen wrote: 'Happy Birthday @WayneRoone ... have a brilliant day with our boys!! All our love always xxx'.

Easy does it: The dad-of-four struggled to climb into the water vessel during the trip

Fun times: Wayne helped his boys as they set off for a day of thrill-seeking

The sporting legend was dressed down in a baseball cap and a hoodie, holding Kit on his shoulders while his two eldest sons put on a playful display.

On Sunday, Coleen first broke her silence and tweeted for the first time since her war of words with Rebekah erupted after she accused her of selling stories about her to the press.

Uploading a shot of her youngest child, Coleen explained she has had to remain in the UK.

'Lovely morning in the fresh air with Cass,' she posted on Sunday evening. 'We had planned to be with the rest of our family in Barbados for half term break.

Thrill-seekers: Wayne, Tony and the boys looked delighted as they were pulled along the water

Look at them go: The thrill-seekers were seen squealing in delight as they were hurled across the water on the back of a speed boat

Making a splash: The family got drenched during their daring ride on the waves

'Unfortunately I became poorly with an infection before we were due to leave. I am not able to join them for the time being, even though I am feeling better [sic]'

The tweet came as Wayne was spotted touching down in Barbados on Sunday to join his three other children for their trip, before joining friends and family on the beach near their home on the Caribbean island.

The football star arrived a few days after his sons, who jetted over with their grandparents Colette and Anthony McLoughlin, Coleen's parents.

Red hot: The sports star appeared to have caught the sun on his holidays

Family outing: The boys clearly had a great time on the water ride

All over: Wayne helped little Kit off the inflatable after their amazing ride

While her family soaked up the sun in the Caribbean, Coleen and her youngest son Cass enjoyed a 'lovely morning in the fresh air' in a local park.

Meanwhile, Coleen's dramatic revelation enthralled Britain and sparked an angry denial from pregnant Rebekah, following claims that she had been selling stories.

She said 'I don't need the money’ and pointed out other people have had access to her Instagram account.

Rebekah recently gave an interview with The Daily Mail, in which she insisted arguing with Coleen is akin to rowing 'with a pigeon.'

Jamie Vardy's wife was pictured returning to the UK in floods of tears after the scandal broke while she herself was on holiday with her football star football Jamie.

Fun day out: Klay was thoroughly enjoying his day with his family

She was supported by Jamie as she returned to London's Heathrow Airport from a family trip to Dubai on Saturday.

In the emotional pictures, Rebekah is seen struggling to hide her tears as she made her way through the busy airport hand-in-hand with husband Jamie.

ans have praised Rooney – calling her ‘Wagatha Christie’ - for the sensational way in which she revealed Vardy was the alleged culprit by concluding her post with a thriller-worthy 'It's......... Rebekah Vardy's account.'

The saga began when Coleen took to social media to reveal she had suspected someone close to her had been betraying her for years and she had conclusive proof that her friend Rebekah was the guilty party.

Tribute: Coleen Rooney wished her husband Wayne a happy 34th birthday on Thursday as they were forced to spend the day apart

Speaking out: Coleen (pictured earlier this month) broke her silence for the first time last Sunday amid her ongoing war of words with fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy

Vardy is a queen of self-promotion who has risen to the top rank of footballers wives from humble beginnings - the daughter of a BBC local radio DJ and a window cleaner father who has two ex husbands.

Before meeting current husband Jamie, she was working in a Sheffield nightclub and dating a Vauxhall conference football player who has previously accused her of ditching him to 'trade up' to Premier League star.

Coleen admitted that stories about her basement flooding, returning to TV and gender selection were only viewed by Rebekah and these were subsequently followed by media outlets, including MailOnline.

The Sun has since removed their story about Coleen's basement flooding after discovering she had made it up.

Cancelled: The WAG, 33, told her Twitter followers she was home in the UK with her youngest son Cass, 20 months, recovering after falling 'poorly with an infection'
